definitions: artistic depiction or representation of something in visual form
interpretation or performance of a musical or dramatic work
process of translating text or speech from one language to another
first coat of plaster applied to a brick or stone surface
examples: The architect's rendering showed the building from multiple angles
Her watercolor rendering captured the essence of the landscape perfectly
The pianist's rendering of Chopin was both delicate and powerful
Their rendering of Shakespeare brought new life to the classic play
The rendering of ancient texts requires deep cultural understanding
Machine rendering has improved but still lacks human nuance
The rendering on the exterior walls needed repair after winter
They applied a cement rendering to waterproof the foundation

definitions: particular performance or interpretation of a dramatic role or musical composition
practice of transferring prisoners between countries outside normal legal processes
examples: Her rendition of the national anthem brought tears to many eyes
The jazz quartet's rendition of classic standards delighted the audience
The report exposed details about extraordinary rendition programs
Human rights groups condemned the practice of rendition without trial

definitions: person who deserts and betrays an organization, country, or principles
person who rebels against authority or behaves in an unconventional way
examples: The renegade soldier fled to enemy territory with classified information
History remembers him as a renegade who betrayed his country
She was a renegade artist who rejected traditional gallery systems
The renegade bikers formed their own independent motorcycle club

definitions: process of making something new, fresh, or strong again through restoration
instance of extending the period of validity of a license or contract
examples: The urban renewal project transformed the abandoned district completely
Spring brings a sense of renewal to gardens and spirits alike
Don't forget about your passport renewal before the trip
The contract renewal negotiations lasted several weeks

definitions: process of improving a broken, damaged, or outdated structure through repair and updates
act of improving something by renewing and restoring its condition
examples: The hotel renovation took eighteen months and cost millions
Kitchen renovation can significantly increase your home's value
The school underwent complete renovation of its science laboratories
The renovation of the historic theater preserved its original charm

definitions: state of being known and talked about by many people for achievements
examples: The scientist gained international renown for her groundbreaking research
Artists of great renown displayed their works at the gallery
The restaurant achieved renown for its innovative fusion cuisine
His renown as a surgeon attracted patients from around the world

definitions: regular payment made by a tenant to a landlord for property use
large tear or opening made by ripping or splitting something
examples: The monthly rent includes utilities and parking space
Rent prices have increased dramatically in urban areas recently
The earthquake left a huge rent in the ground
She discovered a rent in her jacket after the hike

definitions: property or item that is rented or available for rent
business of renting properties or items to customers
amount paid or received as rent for property or equipment
examples: We found a beach rental for our summer vacation
The car rental was more expensive than expected
She manages a rental business specializing in construction equipment
The rental company offers both short and long-term leases
Monthly rental for the office space exceeds our budget
Equipment rental fees are deducted from the project costs

definitions: person who pays rent to use or occupy property or equipment
examples: The renter complained about the broken heating system
New renters must provide references and a security deposit
As a renter, she had limited ability to modify the apartment
The property attracts mostly young professional renters

definitions: act or business of paying to use property or equipment temporarily
examples: Renting an apartment downtown proved more economical than buying
They're considering renting out their basement for extra income
Renting equipment for the event saved thousands of dollars
The cost of renting has increased faster than average wages

definitions: formal declaration of abandoning a claim, right, or possession voluntarily
examples: His renunciation of the throne shocked the entire nation
The monk's renunciation of worldly possessions was complete and sincere
The treaty required renunciation of all territorial claims
Her public renunciation of violence marked a turning point

definitions: process of changing the arrangement, sequence, or priorities of items
examples: The reordering of chapters improved the book's narrative flow
Database reordering optimized the system's performance significantly
A complete reordering of priorities followed the crisis
The reordering of inventory helped reduce storage costs

definitions: process of changing the structure or arrangement of an organization or system
examples: The company's reorganisation resulted in three new divisions
Hospital reorganisation aimed to improve patient care efficiency
The reorganisation of local government created new administrative boundaries
Following bankruptcy, major reorganisation of assets was necessary

definitions: process of organizing something again in a different or more effective way
examples: The corporate reorganization eliminated several redundant departments
Chapter 11 bankruptcy allows for business reorganization while operating
The reorganization of the filing system made documents easier to find
Political reorganization followed the country's independence

definitions: process of changing focus, direction, or fundamental approach to something
examples: The company's reorientation toward digital services proved successful
Cultural reorientation occurred gradually after the political changes
The program includes reorientation for employees switching departments
Strategic reorientation helped the organization survive the crisis

definitions: person who represents a company, especially in sales
informal term for reputation or standing among peers
single repetition of an exercise movement in fitness training
examples: The pharmaceutical rep visited doctors' offices weekly
Our rep handles all accounts in the northeastern region
He built his rep through years of reliable work
Her rep as a tough negotiator preceded her
Do three sets of twelve reps for each exercise
Adding more reps increases muscular endurance

definitions: process of fixing or mending something that is broken or damaged
condition of something after being fixed or restored to working order
examples: The repair of the antique clock required specialized tools
Auto repair costs have increased with newer computer systems
The bridge is finally in good repair after months of work
The house needs extensive repair before anyone can live there

definitions: person whose job is to repair machines, equipment, or structures
examples: The repairman fixed our washing machine within an hour
We called a repairman when the heating system stopped working
An experienced repairman can diagnose problems quickly
The appliance repairman services all major brands

definitions: payment or action to compensate for war damages or historical injustices
act of making amends for a wrong that has been done
examples: The treaty demanded huge war reparations from the defeated nation
Discussions about slavery reparations continue in many countries
He sought to make reparation for the harm he had caused
The company offered reparation to affected customers

definitions: person who has been returned to their country of origin or citizenship
examples: The repatriate struggled to readjust after years abroad
Medical repatriates received special assistance upon arrival
War repatriates often need psychological support services
The government established programs specifically for repatriates

definitions: process of returning someone or something to their country of origin
examples: The repatriation of refugees began after the conflict ended
Repatriation of cultural artifacts remains a contentious issue
Voluntary repatriation programs helped thousands return home safely
The company offers repatriation insurance for overseas employees

definitions: act of paying back money that has been borrowed
amount of money that is paid back to a lender
examples: Monthly loan repayment takes a third of her income
The repayment schedule extends over fifteen years
Early repayment of the mortgage saved thousands in interest
They struggled to keep up with their repayment obligations

definitions: official cancellation or reversal of a law, regulation, or policy
examples: The repeal of prohibition ended thirteen years of alcohol ban
Citizens petitioned for the repeal of the controversial tax
Congressional repeal of the act required a two-thirds majority
The repeal took effect immediately after the governor's signature

definitions: instance of something happening, being done, or being said again
television or radio program that is broadcast again
examples: We can't afford a repeat of last year's mistakes
The pattern includes three repeats of the basic design
Tonight's movie is a repeat from last Sunday
Summer schedules often include many repeats

definitions: electronic device that receives and retransmits a signal
person who repeats something, especially a student repeating a grade
firearm that can fire several shots without reloading
examples: The wireless repeater extended the network coverage upstairs
Cell phone repeaters boost signal strength in remote areas
The teacher noticed several repeaters in her new class
Exam repeaters often perform better the second time
The rifle was a repeater capable of rapid fire
Historical repeaters revolutionized warfare tactics

definitions: act or process of doing, saying, or producing something again
examples: The repeating of instructions ensures everyone understands
Constant repeating of the same mistakes frustrated the coach
The repeating pattern created a hypnotic visual effect
History has a way of repeating itself

definitions: substance that deters insects or other pests from approaching
quality of being able to repel or drive away something
examples: Apply insect repellent before hiking in the woods
The new mosquito repellent lasts for eight hours
Water repellent fabric keeps you dry in light rain
The repellent properties of the coating prevent rust

definitions: deep regret or remorse for wrongdoing accompanied by commitment to change
examples: His repentance for past crimes seemed genuine and heartfelt
True repentance requires more than just saying sorry
The sermon emphasized repentance as a path to redemption
Her public repentance moved many who had condemned her

definitions: complete list of items that a performer or group can perform
range of skills, techniques, or ingredients regularly used
examples: The pianist's repertoire includes works from Bach to Gershwin
They expanded their repertoire to include contemporary pieces
A chef's repertoire should include basic sauce preparations
Her repertoire of teaching methods keeps students engaged

definitions: theater system where a company performs several different plays in rotation
store or collection of things available for use
examples: The repertory theater presents six different plays each season
She trained with a repertory company in regional theater
The library serves as a repertory of historical documents
His memory was a vast repertory of quotations

definitions: action of repeating something that has already been said or written
instance or occurrence of something happening again
examples: Repetition helps students memorize important information
The coach used repetition to perfect the team's technique
We must avoid repetition of past mistakes
The musical piece featured repetition of the main theme

definitions: person or thing that takes the place of another
action or process of replacing someone or something
examples: The replacement part should arrive within two days
Finding a replacement for such an experienced manager proved difficult
Hip replacement surgery has become increasingly common
The replacement of old pipes prevented future leaks

definitions: act of putting someone or something in place of another
examples: Replacing the old windows improved energy efficiency significantly
The cost of replacing worn equipment strained the budget
Replacing staff members disrupted team dynamics temporarily
They're gradually replacing fossil fuels with renewable energy

definitions: act of playing back a recording or showing something again
sports match that is played again after a tie or dispute
examples: The instant replay clearly showed the ball was out
Video replay helped referees make the correct call
The cup replay will be held next Tuesday evening
Rain forced a replay of the championship match

definitions: act of filling something up again or restoring supplies to former level
examples: Automatic inventory replenishment prevents stock shortages
The replenishment of groundwater takes decades in arid regions
Nutrient replenishment helps maintain soil fertility
Regular replenishment of office supplies keeps operations smooth

definitions: exact copy or model of something, especially made on smaller scale
examples: The museum displays a replica of the original painting
They built a half-scale replica of the historic ship
Souvenir shops sell replicas of famous monuments
The replica watches looked identical to genuine ones

definitions: process of copying or reproducing something
repetition of a scientific experiment to verify results
examples: DNA replication occurs before cell division
The replication of data across servers ensures backup
Successful replication of the experiment confirmed the findings
Scientific replication helps validate research claims

definitions: verbal response or answer given in reaction to something
written message sent in response to a letter or communication
examples: His reply to the criticism was calm and measured
She waited patiently for a reply to her question
The email reply arrived within minutes
Please send your reply by the end of the week

definitions: detailed written document about a particular subject or investigation
account of an event or situation given in media or conversation
sudden loud sound like that of an explosion or gunfire
examples: The annual report showed record profits
She submitted her research report to the committee
According to news reports, the storm caused widespread damage
Witness reports helped police reconstruct the incident
The report of the gun echoed through the valley
They heard a loud report from the construction site

definitions: factual presentation of events in newspapers or broadcast media journalism
examples: Her war reportage earned international recognition and awards
Television reportage of the crisis shaped public opinion
The documentary combined investigative reportage with personal narratives
Quality reportage requires thorough research and verification

definitions: person who investigates and reports news for newspapers, television, or radio
examples: The reporter interviewed witnesses at the scene
Foreign reporters faced restrictions in the conflict zone
An investigative reporter uncovered the corruption scandal
Sports reporters travel extensively during the season

definitions: activity of investigating and presenting news in media
process of giving a formal account of something observed or investigated
examples: Objective reporting has become increasingly challenging
Live reporting from the scene provided immediate updates
Financial reporting must comply with regulatory standards
Incident reporting helps identify safety patterns

definitions: state of rest, sleep, or tranquility
calm confidence or composure in manner or bearing
examples: The statue captured a moment of perfect repose
She found repose in the quiet garden retreat
He maintained his repose despite the chaos around him
Her face showed the repose of complete confidence

definitions: act of moving something to a different position or changing market strategy
examples: The reposition of satellites requires precise calculations
Brand reposition helped attract younger consumers
The surgeon performed a reposition of the fractured bone
Market reposition saved the company from bankruptcy

definitions: process of changing position, strategy, or market placement of something
examples: The repositioning of the product line attracted new demographics
Constant repositioning of furniture annoyed her roommates
Strategic repositioning helped the company survive the recession
The repositioning of troops indicated tactical changes

definitions: place where things are stored or can be found
central location where data or knowledge is stored and maintained
examples: The museum serves as a repository for cultural artifacts
Nuclear waste requires a secure underground repository
The online repository contains thousands of research papers
She was a walking repository of local history

definitions: way of showing or describing something in art, media, or literature
action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone else
presence or portrayal of a particular group in society or media
examples: The painting is a representation of rural life
Digital representation allows complex data visualization
Legal representation is a fundamental right in court
Union representation protects workers' interests
The film lacked representation of minority communities
Greater representation in leadership positions is needed

definitions: person chosen to act or speak for another or others
typical of a particular group or class serving as an example
examples: The sales representative covered three states
Each district elects one representative to Congress
This survey provides a representative sample of voters
Her work is representative of modern abstract art

definitions: action of subduing opposition by force or preventing freedom of expression
psychological process of excluding desires or impulses from consciousness
examples: Political repression intensified after the failed uprising
The regime used repression to silence dissenting voices
Emotional repression can lead to psychological problems later
Freud wrote extensively about repression of childhood trauma

definitions: cancellation or postponement of punishment, especially death sentence
temporary escape from an unpleasant situation or experience
examples: The governor granted a last-minute reprieve to the prisoner
The court issued a reprieve pending further evidence
Rain brought a reprieve from the scorching heat
The holiday provided a brief reprieve from work stress
